Name: Ptolemies
History: The Ptolemaic dynasty was a Macedonian Greek royal family which ruled the Ptolemaic Empire in Egypt during the Hellenistic period. Their rule lasted for 275 years, from 305 BC to 30 BC. They were the last dynasty of ancient Egypt.

Factions.Name: Ptolemaic Egyptians
Factions.Description: The great Greek-Macedonian dynastic rule over Ancient Egypt.

Technologies.Name: Romanization Reform
Technologies.History: Late Ptolemaic Egypt employed to Roman influenced swordsmen often trained by Roman mercenary instructors.

Technologies.Name: Machimoi Epilektoi
Technologies.History: Machimoi Epilektoi were an elite force among the Machimoi.
Technologies.Description: Machimoi +10% attack, hit points and vision.

Technologies.Name: Agema Thorakites
Technologies.History: Agema was the name of various royal guard units in hellenistic armies.
Technologies.Description: Thorakites +10% attack, hit points and vision.

Technologies.Name: Mercenary Army
Technologies.History: The Ptolemaic Dynasty relied on large numbers of mercenaries for the bulk of its military force, mainly because the loyalty of native Egyptian units was often suspect. Indeed, during one native uprising, Upper Egypt was lost to the Ptolemies for decades. Mercenaries were often battle-hardened and their loyalty can be bought, sometimes cheaply, sometimes not cheaply. This was of no matter, since Egypt under the Ptolemies was so prosperous as to be the richest of Alexander's successor states.

Technologies.Name: Ptolemaic Garrisons
Technologies.History: The Ptolemies relied extensively on fortified garrisons to protect their overseas and distant possessions.

Heroes.Name: Machimos Phalangites
Heroes.History: Cheap, fast training Champion Pikeman. Deals x3 damage to Cavalry and Elephants.

CivBonuses.Name: Cult Of Isis.
CivBonuses.History: The Macedonian-Greek rulers of the Ptolemaic dynasty observed many ancient Egyptian traditions in order to satiate the local populace and ingratiate themselves to the powerful priestly class in the country.
CivBonuses.Description: Temple technologies -50% cost and research time.

CivBonuses.Name: Nile Delta
CivBonuses.History: The Nile Delta had rich soil for farming, due to centuries of seasonal floods from the Nile depositing rich silt across the landscape.

CivBonuses.Name: Clay Structures
CivBonuses.History: Clay construction provided cheap structures for the Egyptians.
CivBonuses.Description: Houses, Farmsteads, Corrals and Storehouses no resource cost, increased build time.

TeamBonuses.Name: Centre Of Knowledge
TeamBonuses.History: Egypt was a net exporter of grain, so much so that large cities such as Athens, Antioch, and Rome came to rely upon Egyptian grain in order to feed their masses.
TeamBonuses.Description: Ships and Siege Units -10% resource cost (currently not shared).
